com.vmware.vcenter.identity

Interface Providers

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, ProvidersTypes, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProvidersStub

    public interface Providers
extends Service, ProvidersTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Providers interface provides methods to list, read and modify vCenter Server identity providers. This interface was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Providers.CreateInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Providers#create vAPI operation.

      Invocable that represents the Providers#delete vAPI operation.
      static interface  Providers.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Providers#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Providers.ListInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Providers#list vAPI operation.
      static interface  Providers.UpdateInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Providers#update vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.identity.ProvidersTypes

    • Method Detail

      • list

        Providers.ListInvocation list()
        Retrieve all identity providers. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Invocation Result:
        Commonly used information about the identity providers.

        Operation Errors:
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to caller.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIdentityProviders.Read and VcIdentityProviders.Manage.

        Returns:
        instance of Providers.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • get

        Providers.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String provider)
        Retrieve detailed information of the specified identity provider. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Invocation Result:
        Detailed information of the specified identity provider.

        Operation Errors:
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to caller.
        NotFound - if no provider found with the given provider identifier.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIdentityProviders.Read and VcIdentityProviders.Manage.

        Parameters:
        provider - the identifier of the provider The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.identity.Providers.
        Returns:
        instance of Providers.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • create

        Providers.CreateInvocation create(ProvidersTypes.CreateSpec spec)
        Create a vCenter Server identity provider. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Invocation Result:
        The identifier of the created identity provider. The return value will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.identity.Providers.

        Operation Errors:
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to caller.
        InvalidArgument - if invalid arguments are provided in createSpec.
        AlreadyExists - if provider exists for provider ID in given spec.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIdentityProviders.Create and VcIdentityProviders.Manage.

        Parameters:
        spec - the CreateSpec contains the information used to create the provider
        Returns:
        instance of Providers.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • update

        Providers.UpdateInvocation update(java.lang.String provider,
                                  ProvidersTypes.UpdateSpec spec)
        Update a vCenter Server identity provider. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Operation Errors:
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to caller.
        InvalidArgument - if invalid arguments are provided in updateSpec.
        NotFound - if no provider found with the given provider identifier.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIdentityProviders.Manage.

        Parameters:
        provider - the identifier of the provider to update The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.identity.Providers.
        spec - the UpdateSpec contains the information used to update the provider
        Returns:
        instance of Providers.UpdateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described update operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • delete

        Providers.DeleteInvocation delete(java.lang.String provider)
        Delete a vCenter Server identity provider. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Operation Errors:
        Unauthorized - if authorization is not given to caller.
        NotFound - if no provider found with the given provider identifier.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:

        • Method execution requires VcIdentityProviders.Manage.

        Parameters:
        provider - the identifier of the provider to delete The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.identity.Providers.
        Returns:
        instance of Providers.DeleteInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described delete operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
